title: Louis Arnaud, former French hostage held at Iran's Evin prison: 'It's not only a prison that's been reduced to ashes, but the bastion of resistance'
subhead: By bombing Evin prison, Israel has destroyed a place of terror as well as a beacon of hope, as many dissidents were incarcerated there, writes Louis Arnaud, who was detained there for two years.

title: With 'Materialists,' Celine Song explores love in the cruel era of dating
subhead: The filmmaker deftly depicts the romantic indecision of a matchmaker torn between two men.

title: Switzerland hopes hosting Euro 2025 will bring a boost to women's football
subhead: The hosts of the 2025 UEFA Women's Championship are set to face Norway in the tournament's opening match in Basel on Wednesday, July 2. The Swiss team, while aware of its current limitations, hopes hosting the competition will have a lasting impact on women's football in Switzerland.

title: The end of Pakistan's lost paradise of Hunza: 'In just 20 years, our entire environment has changed'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (3/6). In the north of the country, a village that has been isolated from the outside world for centuries is suffering from the combined effects of climate change and the loss of a way of life as it is integrated the country's economy.

subhead: While waiting to enter Gaza on a medical aid mission, an American doctor watched Israeli security forces confiscate the cans of powdered baby formula packed in his luggage. The vital product is desperately lacking in the Palestinian enclave, where about 50 children have died of hunger since March.

title: In Hungary, a decade of dismantling asylum rights
subhead: '2015-2025: Europe's migration crisis' (1/5). In response to the arrival of hundreds of thousands of asylum seekers in the summer of 2015, Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban built a fence in the south of the country to push them away.
